        <li id="cite_note-UNHDR-8"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-UNHDR_8-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/hdr2020.pdf">"Human Development Report 2020"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_Development_Programme" title="United Nations Development Programme">United Nations Development Programme</a>. 15 December 2020<span class="reference-accessdate">.         <li id="cite_note-9"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-9">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Year-month-day also sometimes used, though rarely, mainly used for computing contexts. See <a href="/wiki/Date_and_time_notation_in_Italy" title="Date and time notation in Italy">Date and time notation in Italy</a>.</span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-10"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-10">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.regione.sardegna.it/j/v/86?v=9&amp;c=72&amp;file=1997026">"Legge Regionale 15 ottobre 1997, n. 26"</a>.         <li id="cite_note-11"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-11">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

        <li id="cite_note-20"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-20">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Italy is often grouped in Western Europe. Academic works describing Italy as a Western European country:
          <div>

             <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFHancockConradtPetersSafran1998" class="citation book cs1">Hancock, M.         <li id="cite_note-22"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-22">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFLazenby1998" class="citation book cs1">Lazenby, John Francis (4 February 1998). <span class="cs1-lock-registration" title="Free registration required"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/hannibalswarmili00laze"><i>Hannibal's War: A Military History of the Second Punic War</i></a></span>.         <li id="cite_note-23"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-23">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

        <li id="cite_note-Milena_Sterio-38"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Milena_Sterio_38-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

These states include veto-wielding members of the United Nations Security Council (United States, United Kingdom, France, China, and Russia), as well as economic powerhouses such as Germany, Italy and Japan.</i>")</span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-39"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-39">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFMichael_Barone2010" class="citation web cs1">Michael Barone (2 September 2010). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120922063927/http://www.crvp.org/book/Series04/IV-5/chapter_vi.htm">"The essence of Italian culture and the challenge of the global age"</a>. Council for Research in Values and philosophy.           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110520041048/http://www.insmli.it/pubblicazioni/35/Voto%20donne%20versione%20def.pdf">"Italia 1946: le donne al voto, dossier a cura di Mariachiara Fugazza e Silvia Cassamagnaghi"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>.         <li id="cite_note-145"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-145">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The so-called "Second Republic" was born by forceps: not with a revolt of Algiers, but formally under the same Constitution, with the mere replacement of one ruling class to another:

        <li id="cite_note-172"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-172">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20100205043503/http://www.iii.to.cnr.it/limnol/cicloac/lagit.htm">"Morphometric and hydrological characteristics of some important Italian lakes"</a>.         <li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTECushman-RoisinGačićPoulain20011–2-173"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTECushman-RoisinGačićPoulain20011–2_173-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFCushman-RoisinGačićPoulain2001">Cushman-Roisin, Gačić &amp; Poulain 2001</a>, pp.&nbsp;1–2.<span class="error harv-error" style="display: none; font-size:100%"> sfn error: no target: CITEREFCushman-RoisinGačićPoulain2001 (<a href="/wiki/Category:Harv_and_Sfn_template_errors" title="Category:Harv and Sfn template errors">help</a>)</span></span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-174"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-174">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation book cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20111008191433/http://www.iho.int/iho_pubs/standard/S-23/S-23_Ed3_1953_EN.pdf"><i>Limits of Oceans and Seas</i></a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> (3rd&nbsp;ed.). <a href="/wiki/Organisation_hydrographique_internationale" class="mw-redirect" title="Organisation hydrographique internationale">Organisation hydrographique internationale</a>. 1953.         <li id="cite_note-193"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-193">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

        <li id="cite_note-Encyclopedia_of_the_Nations-198"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Encyclopedia_of_the_Nations_198-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

        <li id="cite_note-199"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-199">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">United Nations Statistics Division, Millennium Development Goals indicators: <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://mdgs.un.org/unsd/mdg/SeriesDetail.aspx?srid=749&amp;crid=">Carbon dioxide emissions (<span class="nowrap"><span class="chemf nowrap">CO<span style="display:inline-block; margin-bottom:-0.3em; vertical-align:-0.4em; line-height:1.2em; font-size:70%; text-align:left;"><br>2</span></span></span>), thousand metric tons of <span class="nowrap"><span class="chemf nowrap">CO<span style="display:inline-block; margin-bottom:-0.3em; vertical-align:-0.4em; line-height:1.2em; font-size:70%; text-align:left;"><br>2</span></span></span></a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20091225014715/http://mdgs.un.org/unsd/mdg/SeriesDetail.aspx?srid=749&amp;crid=">Archived</a> 25 December 2009 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a> (collected by CDIAC)</span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-200"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-200">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Human-produced, direct emissions of carbon dioxide only. Excludes other greenhouse gases; land-use, land-use-change and forestry (LULUCF); and natural background flows of <span class="nowrap"><span class="chemf nowrap">CO<span style="display:inline-block; margin-bottom:-0.3em; vertical-align:-0.4em; line-height:1.2em; font-size:70%; text-align:left;"><br>2</span></span></span> (See also: <a href="/wiki/Carbon_cycle" title="Carbon cycle">Carbon cycle</a>)</span> </li>

        <li id="cite_note-209"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-209">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFBeckZimmermannMcVicarVergopolan2018" class="citation journal cs1">Beck, Hylke E.; Zimmermann, Niklaus E.; McVicar, Tim R.; Vergopolan, Noemi; Berg, Alexis; Wood, Eric F.         <li id="cite_note-Walters-223"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Walters_223-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Walters_223-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Walters_223-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Walters_223-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Walters_223-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Walters_223-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">

        <li id="cite_note-BuonannoMastrobuoni-224"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-BuonannoMastrobuoni_224-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-BuonannoMastrobuoni_224-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-BuonannoMastrobuoni_224-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-BuonannoMastrobuoni_224-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-BuonannoMastrobuoni_224-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-BuonannoMastrobuoni_224-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFPaulo_BuonannoGiovanni_Mastrobuoni2013" class="citation encyclopaedia cs1">Paulo Buonanno; Giovanni Mastrobuoni (2013). "Centralized versus Decentralized Police Hiring in Italy and the United States". In Philip J. Cook; Stephen Machin; Olivier Marie; Giovanni Mastrobuoni (eds.). <i>Lessons from the Economics of Crime: What Reduces Offending?</i>. MIT Press. p.&nbsp;193. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.7551%2Fmitpress%2F9780262019613.001.0001">10.7551/mitpress/9780262019613.001.0001</a>. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-262-01961-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-262-01961-3"><bdi>978-0-262-01961-3</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Centralized+versus+Decentralized+Police+Hiring+in+Italy+and+the+United+States&amp;rft.btitle=Lessons+from+the+Economics+of+Crime%3A+What+Reduces+Offending%3F&amp;rft.pages=193&amp;rft.pub=MIT+Press&amp;rft.date=2013&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.7551%2Fmitpress%2F9780262019613.001.0001&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-262-01961-3&amp;rft.au=Paulo+Buonanno&amp;rft.au=Giovanni+Mastrobuoni&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AItaly" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li>

        <li id="cite_note-242"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-242">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20140715152504/http://www.export.gov/italy/static/2014%20CCG%20Italy_Latest_eg_it_076513.pdf">"Doing Business in Italy: 2014 Country Commercial Guide for U.S. Companies"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <a href="/wiki/United_States_Commercial_Service" title="United States Commercial Service">United States Commercial Service</a>.           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://easst.net/science-and-technology-parks-in-italy/">"Science and Technology Parks in Italy"</a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Science+and+Technology+Parks+in+Italy&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Feasst.net%2Fscience-and-technology-parks-in-italy%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AItaly" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-315"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-315">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">G. Bar "Trieste, è record europeo di ricercatori: 37 ogni mille abitanti. Più della Finlandia", In: il Fatto Quotidiano, 26 April 2018.</span> </li>

        <li id="cite_note-334"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-334">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

Visited 11 April 2006.</span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-lang-351"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-lang_351-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-lang_351-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.camera.it/parlam/leggi/99482l.htm">"Legge 15 Dicembre 1999, n. 482 "Norme in materia di tutela delle minoranze linguistiche storiche" pubblicata nella Gazzetta Ufficiale n. 297 del 20 dicembre 1999"</a>. <a href="/wiki/Italian_Parliament" title="Italian Parliament">Italian Parliament</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20150512051856/http://www.camera.it/parlam/leggi/99482l.htm">Archived</a> from the original on 12 May 2015<span class="reference-accessdate">.         <li id="cite_note-369"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-369">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation news cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20180124122738/http://www.acli.it/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Cattolici-e-politica-analisi-Ipsos-novembre-2017.pdf">"I cattolici tra presenza nel sociale e nuove domande alla politica – novembre 2017"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>.         <li id="cite_note-370"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-370">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation news cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/1985-06-04/news/8501220260_1_italian-state-new-agreement-church">"Catholicism No Longer Italy's State Religion"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Sun_Sentinel" class="mw-redirect" title="Sun Sentinel">Sun Sentinel</a></i>. 4 June 1985. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20131020143004/http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/1985-06-04/news/8501220260_1_italian-state-new-agreement-church">Archived</a> from the original on 20 October 2013<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">7 September</span> 2013</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Sun+Sentinel&amp;rft.atitle=Catholicism+No+Longer+Italy%27s+State+Religion&amp;rft.date=1985-06-04&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Farticles.sun-sentinel.com%2F1985-06-04%2Fnews%2F8501220260_1_italian-state-new-agreement-church&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AItaly" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-371"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-371">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.pewforum.org/2013/02/13/the-global-catholic-population/">"The Global Catholic Population"</a>. <i>Pew Research Center's Religion &amp; Public Life Project</i>. 13 February 2013.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Pew+Research+Center%27s+Religion+%26+Public+Life+Project&amp;rft.atitle=The+Global+Catholic+Population&amp;rft.date=2013-02-13&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pewforum.org%2F2013%2F02%2F13%2Fthe-global-catholic-population%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AItaly" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-372"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-372">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Text taken directly from 
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20101231084624/http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/travel-and-living-abroad/travel-advice-by-country/country-profile/europe/holy-see/">"Archived copy"</a>. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/travel-and-living-abroad/travel-advice-by-country/country-profile/europe/holy-see/">the original</a> on 31 December 2010<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">5 February</span> 2016</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Archived+copy&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.fco.gov.uk%2Fen%2Ftravel-and-living-abroad%2Ftravel-advice-by-country%2Fcountry-profile%2Feurope%2Fholy-see%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AItaly" class="Z3988"></span><span class="cs1-maint citation-comment">CS1 maint: archived copy as title (<a href="/wiki/Category:CS1_maint:_archived_copy_as_title" title="Category:CS1 maint: archived copy as title">link</a>)</span> (viewed on 14 December 2011), on the website of the British Foreign &amp; Commonwealth Office.</span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-373"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-373">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The Holy See's sovereignty has been recognized explicitly in many international agreements and is particularly emphasized in article 2 of the <a href="/wiki/Lateran_Treaty" title="Lateran Treaty">Lateran Treaty</a> of 11 February 1929, in which "Italy recognizes the sovereignty of the Holy See in international matters as an inherent attribute in conformity with its traditions and the requirements of its mission to the world" (<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.aloha.net/~mikesch/treaty.htm">Lateran Treaty, English translation</a>).</span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-374"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-374">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFLeustean2014" class="citation book cs1">Leustean, Lucian N. (2014). <i>Eastern Christianity and Politics in the Twenty-First Century</i>.         <li id="cite_note-:110-392"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-:110_392-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFDuarte,_A.,_Fernandes,_J.,_Bernardes,_J._&amp;_Miguel,_G.2016" class="citation journal cs1">Duarte, A., Fernandes, J., Bernardes, J. &amp; Miguel, G.         <li id="cite_note-dev.prenhall_a-393"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-dev.prenhall_a_393-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-dev.prenhall_a_393-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20090701064229/http://dev.prenhall.com/divisions/hss/worldreference/IT/health.html">"Italy – Health"</a>.           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.censis.it/10?resource_50=4721">"Senza la mafia il Sud raggiunge il Nord"</a>. <i>Censis</i> (in Italian)<span class="reference-accessdate">.         <li id="cite_note-407"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-407">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Italy has been described as a "cultural superpower" by <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.arabnews.com/italy-cultural-superpower">Arab news</a>, <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/entertainment/coming-to-the-us-the-year-of-italian-culture-2013/2012/10/15/29f404a8-1703-11e2-9855-71f2b202721b_story.html">the Washington Post</a>, <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://m.theaustralian.com.au/arts/italys-cultural-superpower-status-at-stake/story-e6frg8n6-1111113103044">The Australian</a>, <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://italoamericano.com/story/2012-11-8/InterviewGeneralConsulSF#.VJgPzYA1">the Italian consul general in San Francisco</a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20151127074301/http://italoamericano.com/story/2012-11-8/InterviewGeneralConsulSF#.VJgPzYA1">Archived</a> 27 November 2015 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a>, <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/entertainment/coming-to-the-us-the-year-of-italian-culture-2013/2012/10/15/29f404a8-1703-11e2-9855-71f2b202721b_story.html">the former Foreign Affairs Minister Giulio Terzi</a> and <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.laquilablog.it/obama-litalia-superpotenza-culturale/48727-0409/">the U.S. President Barack Obama</a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20141226231012/http://www.arabnews.com/italy-cultural-superpower">Archived</a> 26 December 2014 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a>.</span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-408"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-408">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFKillinger2005" class="citation book cs1">Killinger, Charles (2005). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/culturecustomsof00char/page/3"><i>Culture and customs of Italy</i></a> (1. publ.&nbsp;ed.). Westport, Conn.: Greenwood Press. p.&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/culturecustomsof00char/page/3">3</a>. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-313-32489-5" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-313-32489-5"><bdi>978-0-313-32489-5</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Culture+and+customs+of+Italy&amp;rft.place=Westport%2C+Conn.&amp;rft.pages=3&amp;rft.edition=1.+publ.&amp;rft.pub=Greenwood+Press&amp;rft.date=2005&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-313-32489-5&amp;rft.aulast=Killinger&amp;rft.aufirst=Charles&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fculturecustomsof00char%2Fpage%2F3&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AItaly" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-409"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-409">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

        <li id="cite_note-Britannica-Shakespeare-428"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Britannica-Shakespeare_428-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation encyclopaedia cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/70836/Giovanni-Boccaccio/755/The-Decameron">"Giovanni Boccaccio: The Decameron."</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Encyclop%C3%A6dia_Britannica" title="Encyclopædia Britannica">Encyclopædia Britannica</a></i>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20131219020413/http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/70836/Giovanni-Boccaccio/755/The-Decameron">Archived</a> from the original on 19 December 2013<span class="reference-accessdate">.         <li id="cite_note-429"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-429">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Steven Swann Jones, <i>The Fairy Tale: The Magic Mirror of Imagination</i>, Twayne Publishers, New York, 1995, 
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-8057-0950-9" title="Special:BookSources/0-8057-0950-9">0-8057-0950-9</a>, p. 38</span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-430"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-430">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Bottigheimer 2012a, 7; Waters 1894, xii; Zipes 2015, 599.</span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-431"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-431">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFOpieOpie1974" class="citation cs2"><a href="/wiki/Iona_Opie" class="mw-redirect" title="Iona Opie">Opie, Iona</a>; <a href="/wiki/Peter_Opie" class="mw-redirect" title="Peter Opie">Opie, Peter</a> (1974), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/classicfairytale00opie_0"><i>The Classic Fairy Tales</i></a>, Oxford and New York: Oxford University Press, <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-19-211559-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-19-211559-1"><bdi>978-0-19-211559-1</bdi></a></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Classic+Fairy+Tales&amp;rft.place=Oxford+and+New+York&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=1974&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-19-211559-1&amp;rft.aulast=Opie&amp;rft.aufirst=Iona&amp;rft.au=Opie%2C+Peter&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fclassicfairytale00opie_0&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AItaly" class="Z3988"></span> See p. 20. The claim for earliest fairy-tale is still debated, see for example Jan M. Ziolkowski, <i>Fairy tales from before fairy tales: the medieval Latin past of wonderful lies</i>, University of Michigan Press, 2007. Ziolkowski examines <a href="/wiki/Egbert_of_Li%C3%A8ge" title="Egbert of Liège">Egbert of Liège</a>'s Latin beast poem <i>Fecunda natis</i> (<i>The Richly Laden Ship</i>, c. 1022/24), the earliest known version of "<a href="/wiki/Little_Red_Riding_Hood" title="Little Red Riding Hood">Little Red Riding Hood</a>". Further info: <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20071023044216/http://www.leithart.com/archives/003139.php">Little Red Pentecostal</a>, Peter J. Leithart, 9 July 2007.</span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-Gasparini-432"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Gasparini_432-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Gasparini_432-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Giovanni Gasparini. <i>La corsa di Pinocchio</i>. Milano, Vita e Pensiero, 1997. p. 117. 
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/88-343-4889-3" title="Special:BookSources/88-343-4889-3">88-343-4889-3</a></span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-433"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-433">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

        <li id="cite_note-Rudlin-454"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Rudlin_454-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

        <li id="cite_note-books.google.co.uk-468"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-books.google.co.uk_468-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-books.google.co.uk_468-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFKimbell,_David_R.B.1994" class="citation book cs1">Kimbell, David R.B.         <li id="cite_note-469"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-469">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFKeller,_Catalano_and_Colicci2017" class="citation book cs1">Keller, Catalano and Colicci (25 September 2017). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Gh03DwAAQBAJ&amp;q=keller%20catalano%20and%20colicci&amp;pg=PT1022"><i>Garland Encyclopedia of World Music</i></a>. pp.&nbsp;604–625. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-351-54426-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-351-54426-9"><bdi>978-1-351-54426-9</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Garland+Encyclopedia+of+World+Music&amp;rft.pages=604-625&amp;rft.date=2017-09-25&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-351-54426-9&amp;rft.au=Keller%2C+Catalano+and+Colicci&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DGh03DwAAQBAJ%26q%3Dkeller%2520catalano%2520and%2520colicci%26pg%3DPT1022&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AItaly" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-470"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-470">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation news cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2012/10/04/arts/music/jovanotti-italian-rapper-brings-his-act-to-new-york.html">"A Roman Rapper Comes to New York, Where He Can Get Real"</a>. <i>The New York Times</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">24 February</span> 2014</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+New+York+Times&amp;rft.atitle=A+Roman+Rapper+Comes+to+New+York%2C+Where+He+Can+Get+Real&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2012%2F10%2F04%2Farts%2Fmusic%2Fjovanotti-italian-rapper-brings-his-act-to-new-york.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AItaly" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-471"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-471">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFSharpe-Young2003" class="citation book cs1"><a href="/wiki/MusicMight" title="MusicMight">Sharpe-Young, Garry</a> (2003). <i>A–Z of Power Metal</i>. Rockdetector Series. Cherry Red Books. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-901447-13-2" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-901447-13-2"><bdi>978-1-901447-13-2</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=A%E2%80%93Z+of+Power+Metal&amp;rft.series=Rockdetector+Series&amp;rft.pub=Cherry+Red+Books&amp;rft.date=2003&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-901447-13-2&amp;rft.aulast=Sharpe-Young&amp;rft.aufirst=Garry&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AItaly" class="Z3988"></span> "American metal such as Queensrÿche, Attacker, Jag Panzer, Iced Earth, Liege Lord, and Savatage; European bands such as Helloween, Gamma Ray, Blind Guardian, Running Wild, and Grave Digger;"</span> </li> 
        <li id="cite_note-Moroder-472"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Moroder_472-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Moroder_472-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">"This record was a collaboration between Philip Oakey, the big-voiced lead singer of the techno-pop band the Human League, and Giorgio Moroder, the Italian-born father of disco who spent the '80s writing synth-based pop and film music." 
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFEvan_Cater" class="citation web cs1">Evan Cater. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.allmusic.com/album/r59464">"Philip Oakey &amp; Giorgio Moroder: Overview"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/AllMusic" title="AllMusic">AllMusic</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">.         <li id="cite_note-488"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-488">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
          <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20130927033216/http://www.federtennis.it/DettaglioNews.asp?IDNews=55672">"Il tennis è il quarto sport in Italia per numero di praticanti"</a>.           <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/Northeast_Italy" title="Northeast Italy">Northeast</a></th>

           <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
            <ul>
             <li><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/77/Flag_of_Emilia-Romagna_%28de_facto%29.svg/23px-Flag_of_Emilia-Romagna_%28de_facto%29.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="14" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/77/Flag_of_Emilia-Romagna_%28de_facto%29.svg/35px-Flag_of_Emilia-Romagna_%28de_facto%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/77/Flag_of_Emilia-Romagna_%28de_facto%29.svg/46px-Flag_of_Emilia-Romagna_%28de_facto%29.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="851" data-file-height="524">&nbsp;</span><a href="/wiki/Emilia-Romagna" title="Emilia-Romagna">Emilia-Romagna</a></li>

                        </ul></li> 
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Bailiwick_of_Guernsey" title="Bailiwick of Guernsey">Guernsey</a></li> 
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Isle_of_Man" title="Isle of Man">Isle of Man</a></li> 
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Jersey" title="Jersey">Jersey</a> 
                        <ul>
                         <li><a href="/wiki/Crown_Dependencies" title="Crown Dependencies">Crown Dependencies</a></li>
                        </ul></li>
                      </ul> 
                     </div></td>
                   </tr>
                  </tbody>
                 </table>
                 <div></div></td>
               </tr>
               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">
                 <div style="display:inline-block; padding:0.1em 0;line-height:1.2em;">
                  Special areas of
                  <br>internal sovereignty
                 </div></th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"></div>
                 <table class="nowraplinks navbox-subgroup" style="border-spacing:0">
                  <tbody>
                   <tr>
                    <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Finland</th>
                    <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                     <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                      <ul>
                       <li><a href="/wiki/%C3%85land_Islands" title="Åland Islands">Åland Islands</a> 
                        <ul>
                         <li><a href="/wiki/Autonomous_administrative_division" title="Autonomous administrative division">autonomous region</a> subject to the <a href="/wiki/%C3%85land_convention" title="Åland convention">Åland Convention of 1921</a></li>
                        </ul></li>
                      </ul> 
                     </div></td>
                   </tr>
                   <tr>
                    <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Norway</th>
                    <td class="navbox-list navbox-even" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                     <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                      <ul>
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Svalbard" title="Svalbard">Svalbard</a> 
                        <ul>
                         <li><a href="/wiki/Unincorporated_area" title="Unincorporated area">unincorporated area</a> subject to the <a href="/wiki/Svalbard_Treaty" title="Svalbard Treaty">Svalbard Treaty</a></li>
                        </ul></li>
                      </ul> 
                     </div></td>
                   </tr>
                   <tr>
                    <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">United Kingdom</th>
                    <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                     <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                      <ul>
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Northern_Ireland" title="Northern Ireland">Northern Ireland</a> 
                        <ul>
                         <li><a href="/wiki/Countries_of_the_United_Kingdom" title="Countries of the United Kingdom">country of the United Kingdom</a> subject to the <a href="/wiki/Good_Friday_Agreement" title="Good Friday Agreement">British-Irish Agreement</a></li>
                        </ul></li>
                      </ul> 
                     </div></td>
                   </tr>
                  </tbody>
                 </table>
                 <div></div></td>
               </tr>
               <tr>
                <td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3" style="text-align:left;">
                 <div>
                  <div class="plainlist">
                   <ul>
                    <li><sup>1</sup> <a href="/wiki/Island#Oceanic_islands" title="Island">Oceanic islands</a> within the vicinity of Europe are usually grouped with the continent even though they are not situated on its continental shelf.</li>
                    <li><sup>2</sup> Some countries completely outside the conventional geographical boundaries of Europe are commonly associated with the continent due to ethnological links.</li>
                   </ul>
                  </div>
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
              </tbody>
             </table>
            </div>

                   <li><a href="/wiki/Malta" title="Malta">Malta</a></li>

                   <li><a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Poland</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Portugal" title="Portugal">Portugal</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Romania" title="Romania">Romania</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Slovakia" title="Slovakia">Slovakia</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Slovenia" title="Slovenia">Slovenia</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Spain" title="Spain">Spain</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Sweden" title="Sweden">Sweden</a></li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
               <tr>
                <td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3">
                 <div>
                  <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
                   See also: <a href="/wiki/Membership_of_the_United_Kingdom_in_the_European_Economic_Area" title="Membership of the United Kingdom in the European Economic Area">UK membership</a>, <a href="/wiki/Switzerland%E2%80%93European_Union_relations" title="Switzerland–European Union relations">CH–EU relations</a>, and <a href="/wiki/United_Kingdom%E2%80%93European_Union_relations" title="United Kingdom–European Union relations">UK–EU relations</a>
                  </div>
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
              </tbody>
             </table>

                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">History</th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                  <ul>
                   <li><a href="/wiki/OECD#Founding" title="OECD">Convention on the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development</a></li>

                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Guidelines</th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                  <ul>
                   <li><a href="/wiki/OECD_Guidelines_for_Multinational_Enterprises" title="OECD Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises">Multinational Enterprises</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/OECD_Guidelines_for_the_Testing_of_Chemicals" title="OECD Guidelines for the Testing of Chemicals">Testing of Chemicals</a></li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
              </tbody>
             </table>
            </div>

                  </ul>

                <td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2">
                 <div> 
                  <ol>
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Special_administrative_regions_of_China" title="Special administrative regions of China">Special administrative regions of the People's Republic of China</a>, participates as "Hong Kong, China" and "Macao China".</li> 
                   <li>Officially the Republic of China, participates as "<a href="/wiki/Chinese_Taipei" title="Chinese Taipei">Separate Customs Territory of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen and Matsu</a>", and "Chinese Taipei" in short.</li>
                  </ol>

                   <li><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/France" title="France"><img alt="France" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/23px-Flag_of_France.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/35px-Flag_of_France.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/45px-Flag_of_France.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"></a></span>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/France" title="France">France</a></li> 
                   <li><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Germany" title="Germany"><img alt="Germany" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/ba/Flag_of_Germany.svg/23px-Flag_of_Germany.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="14" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/ba/Flag_of_Germany.svg/35px-Flag_of_Germany.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/ba/Flag_of_Germany.svg/46px-Flag_of_Germany.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1000" data-file-height="600"></a></span>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Germany" title="Germany">Germany</a></li> 
                   <li><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/India" title="India"><img alt="India" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/41/Flag_of_India.svg/23px-Flag_of_India.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/41/Flag_of_India.svg/35px-Flag_of_India.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/41/Flag_of_India.svg/45px-Flag_of_India.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1350" data-file-height="900"></a></span>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/India" title="India">India</a></li>

             <li><span class="nowrap"><a href="/wiki/NARA_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="NARA (identifier)">NARA</a>: <span class="uid"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://catalog.archives.gov/id/10035812">10035812</a></span></span></li>
